feat.name: Apparition Sense
entries: You can see and interact with things others can't. You have apparition sight, an imprecise sense that allows you to detect the presence of {@condition invisible} or {@condition hidden} spirits, haunts, and undead within 30 feet of you.

You can allow a spirit or undead otherwise incapable of speech to speak through you as long as you are in direct contact with it. As an activity that takes 10 minutes, you can act as a link between disembodied souls and their mortal bodies. As long as you are in contact with both a spirit and a living body that belonged to it in life during that entire time, the spirit can use you to return to that body; this does not allow you to bring the dead back to life, but can assist in restoring a disembodied soul to a still-living body. If the body is occupied by another spirit or soul, that entity must succeed at a Will save against your spell DC or be cast from the body when its original owner is returned.

feat.name: Channeler's Stance
entries: You enter a stance that allows power to flow through you. While in this stance, whenever you cast or {@action Sustain a Spell||Sustain} an apparition spell or vessel spell that deals energy damage, you gain a status bonus to the spell's damage equal to the spell's rank.

Each time you {@action Cast a Spell} that has the {@trait vitality} or {@trait void} traits and that restores Hit Points while in this stance, the spells' targets gain a status bonus to the initial amount of healing received equal to the spell's rank. This bonus healing does not apply to healing over time effects (such as {@ability fast healing} or {@ability regeneration}).

feat.name: Circle of Spirits
entries: With a thought, word, or gesture, you reach your mind out to another spirit. Choose another apparition from among those you've attuned to; it becomes your primary apparition, replacing your current one.
special: The number of Focus Points in your focus pool is equal to the number of focus spells you have or the number of apparitions you are attuned to, whichever is higher (maximum 3).

feat.name: Relinquish Control
entries: Your apparition takes over and shields you from outside influence. Until the start of your next turn, you gain a +4 status bonus on saves against spells and effects that give you the {@condition controlled} condition or attempt to influence your actions (such as {@spell charm}, {@spell command}, or a {@creature nosoi||nosoi's} haunting melody). However, the only actions you can take are to {@action Recall Knowledge}, {@action Step}, {@action Strike}, {@action Cast a Spell||Cast an apparition Spell}, {@action Cast a Spell||Cast a vessel Spell}, {@action Sustain a Spell||Sustain a vessel spell}, or use an action that has the {@trait apparition} trait. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus on all {@action Recall Knowledge} checks made using {@skill Lore} skills granted by your attuned apparitions.
special: This feat requires a particularly strong bond with a specific apparition to learn. Choose {@filter one apparition|optionalfeatures||Feature Type=Apparition} you have access to; once you learn this feat, you must always choose that apparition as one of the apparitions you attune to each day.

feat.name: Spirit Familiar
entries: When you attune to your apparitions during your daily preparations, you can choose to dedicate a small amount of your life force to allow one of them to physically manifest as a {@quickref familiar|CRB|0|familiars|0} (Player Core 212), which gains the {@trait spirit} trait. If your familiar is slain or destroyed, you lose all other benefits from the apparition until you remanifest the familiar during your next daily preparations. If you disperse the apparition you have manifested as a familiar, the familiar is destroyed.

feat.name: Conceal Spell
entries: You speak with the unheard voice of the spirits. If the next action you use is to {@action Cast a Spell}, the spell gains the {@trait subtle|PC1} trait, hiding the shining runes, sparks of magic, and other manifestations that would usually give away your spellcasting. The trait hides only the spell's spellcasting actions and manifestations, not its effects, so an observer might still see a ray streak out from you or see you vanish into thin air.

feat.name: Embodiment of the Balance
entries: Your place in the balance between the forces of life and entropy expands the spells you can pull from the spirit realms. You add {@spell heal|PC1} and {@spell harm|PC1} to your apparition spell repertoire, allowing you to cast them with your apparition spellcasting.

feat.name: Enhanced Familiar
entries: You are able to materialize more of your attuned apparition's essence, creating a more powerful vessel for it to inhabit and aid you with. You can select four {@quickref familiar or master abilities|CRB|0|familiars|0}, instead of two.

feat.name: Grasping Spirits Spell
entries: Gaining substance from your magic, your apparitions increase the range of your spells, which then pull your enemy closer. If the next action you use is to {@action Cast a Spell} that has a range and targets one creature, increase that spell's range by 30 feet. As is standard for increasing spell ranges, if the spell normally has a range of touch, you extend its range to 30 feet. In addition to the normal effects of the spell, your apparitions briefly take on semi-physical forms and attempt to drag the target toward you. The target must attempt a Fortitude saving throw against your spell DC; on a failure, it is pulled up to 30 feet directly toward you.

feat.name: Spiritual Expansion Spell
entries: Your apparitions manifest to scatter the energy of your spell. If the next action you use is to {@action Cast a Spell} that has an area of a burst, cone, or line and does not have a duration, increase the area of that spell. Add 5 feet to the radius of a burst that normally has a radius of at least 10 feet (a burst with a smaller radius is not affected). Add 5 feet to the length of a cone or line that is normally 15 feet long or smaller, and add 10 feet to the length of a larger cone or line.

You can also use this feat to increase the radius of an emanation spell with a duration by 5 feet by dedicating your primary apparition to maintaining the spellshape; dedicating the apparition to the spell prevents you from using the apparition's vessel spell, apparition skills, or {@spell avatar} form for the duration of the modified spell.

feat.name: Apparition's Enhancement
feat.requirements: Your most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip spell.
entries: Spiritual power encases your weapon or unarmed attack. Until the end of your turn, one wielded weapon or unarmed attack you have deals an extra {@damage 1d6} spirit damage and gains the {@trait divine} trait, if it didn't have it already.

feat.name: Channeled Protection
feat.requirements: You are in Channeler's Stance and your last action was to {@action Cast a Spell} from your spell slots.
entries: Your apparition uses excess energy to protect you. You and all adjacent allies gain a +1 status bonus to your AC and to your Reflex saving throws until the start of your next turn. If the spell was at least 7th rank, the status bonus increase to +2.

feat.name: Walk the Wilds
entries: You know the ways of birds and beasts and have gained the right to wear their forms. You add {@spell animal form} to your apparition spell repertoire, allowing you to cast it with your apparition spellcasting.
special: If you cast the {@spell darkened forest form|WoI} focus spell (page 20) to turn into a form granted by {@spell animal form}, you can {@action Sustain a Spell||Sustain} it up to 5 minutes instead of its normal duration.

feat.name: Apparition Stabilization
entries: Your attuned apparition ensures that even if you would be distracted or disrupted, your magic does not go to waste. If a reaction would disrupt your spellcasting action, attempt a DC {@flatDC 15} flat check. If you succeed, your action isn't disrupted. When you gain the third apparition class feature, this DC is reduced to {@flatDC 13}, and when you gain the fourth apparition class feature, this DC is reduced to {@flatDC 10}.

feat.name: Blazing Spirit
feat.trigger: A creature damages you with a melee attack.
feat.requirements: Your attuned apparition grants {@skill Lore||Battlegrounds Lore} or {@skill Lore||Volcano Lore} as an apparition skill.
entries: Your apparition grants fiery defenses. You gain resistance equal to your level against the triggering damage, and the triggering creature takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage and 1 {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire damage}. This damage increases to {@damage 2d6} fire damage and 2 {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire damage} at 12th level, and {@damage 3d6} fire damage and 3 {@condition persistent damage||persistent fire damage} at 18th level.

feat.name: Grudge Strike
feat.requirements: Your attuned apparition grants {@skill Lore||Heraldry Lore} or {@skill Lore||Underworld Lore} as an apparition skill.
entries: You channel the spiritual power of spiteful grudges. Make a melee {@action Strike} against a creature within your reach. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your attack roll and deal an additional {@damage 2d6} void damage to the target; if the target is undead or otherwise has void healing, this {@action Strike} instead deals an additional {@damage 2d6} vitality damage. This ability gains the {@trait vitality} trait if it deals vitality damage, or the {@trait void} trait if it deals void damage.

feat.name: Medium's Awareness
entries: Your apparitions watch over you. You gain a +2 status bonus to {@skill Perception} checks made to {@action Seek} and when using {@skill Perception} for your initiative roll. At 12th level, this status bonus increases to +3, and at 20th level, to +4.

feat.name: Roaring Heart
feat.requirements: Your attuned apparition grants {@skill Lore||Mountain Lore} as an apparition skill.
entries: You surge forward inexorably. You {@action Stride} twice. At any point during this movement, you can {@action Shove} up to two creatures you pass adjacent to. When you end the movement, the turbulent spirits you're attuned to reward you for acting in an appropriately fierce manner: you and each ally in a 30-foot emanation gain temporary Hit Points equal to half your level if you successfully Shoved at least one enemy, or equal to your level if you succeeded at Shoving both. These temporary Hit Points last until the beginning of your next turn.

feat.name: Apparition's Reflection
entries: Your apparition infuses your body with additional power. You regain one expended apparition spell slot that is at least 2 ranks lower than your highest-rank spell slot and takes 1, 2, or 3 actions to Cast. You then immediately cast an apparition spell that can be cast using that slot. The number of actions required for Echo of Spirits is equal to the action cost of the spell cast. Maintaining control after such a surge is difficult, however; after casting the spell, you're {@condition confused} until the end of your next turn.

feat.name: Instinctive Maneuvers
entries: When you allow an apparition control over your body, it might vent its fury against your foes. When you Relinquish Control, you add {@action Grapple}, {@action Reposition|PC1}, {@action Shove}, and {@action Trip} to the list of actions you can take. You gain a +2 status bonus to the {@skill Athletics} check to attempt these actions.

feat.name: Spirit Walk
entries: Your allied apparitions ward you against the predations of their restless peers. You and allies in a 30-foot emanation gain a +2 status bonus to {@action Recall Knowledge} checks about spirits, haunts, and undead. While you're {@action Search||Searching} or {@action Detect Magic||Detecting Magic} in exploration mode, this bonus also applies to AC and saves against reactions any of you trigger from haunts and spirits. During your first turn in an encounter, you and allies in the aura have resistance equal to half your level against damage dealt by haunts or spirits.

feat.name: Wind Seeker
entries: Wings free you from the shackles of the ground below. You add {@spell aerial form} to your apparition spell repertoire, allowing you to cast it with your apparition spellcasting. Whenever you use {@spell aerial form} to gain a form that grants you a specific {@skill Acrobatics} modifier, you gain a +1 status bonus to {@skill Acrobatics} checks.
special: If you are attuned to an apparition of {@optfeature stalker in darkened boughs|WoI|darkened boughs} (page 20), add the bat and bird forms in {@spell aerial form} to your {@spell darkened forest form|WoI} lists.

feat.name: Apparition's Quickening
feat.requirements: You are attuned to at least 2 apparitions.
entries: If your next action is to cast a cantrip or a spell that is at least 2 ranks lower than the highest-rank spell slot you have, you can draw power from one of your attuned apparitions to reduce the number of actions to cast it by 1 (minimum 1 action). The chosen apparition is dispersed until you can re-attune to it at your next daily preparations, but you can't disperse an apparition in this way if you would no longer be attuned to any apparitions afterward.
special: This can only be used on a cantrip or spell from the class matching the one you gained this feat from.

feat.name: Fly on Shadowed Wings
entries: Your apparition embraces you, feeding on your magic to become a pair of protective wings. Choose one of your attuned apparitions; for 10 minutes, you gain a fly Speed equal to your land Speed and resistance to precision damage equal to your level, but your chosen apparition is dispersed for the duration, automatically re-attuning to you after 10 minutes.

feat.name: Incredible Familiar
entries: Your connection to your apparition and your mastery of spiritual magic reach a new threshold that allows you to channel even more power into the physical form you allow it to take on as your familiar. You can select a base of six {@quickref familiar or master abilities|CRB|0|familiars|0} each day, instead of four.

feat.name: Apparition Cloud
feat.trigger: You are targeted by an attack.
feat.requirements: Your familiar is adjacent to you or in your space.
entries: With a mere thought, you discorporate your familiar into a thousand shards of spiritual magic, protecting both it and yourself from physical harm while making it difficult for enemies to move near you. You are {@condition concealed} from the triggering attack. Until the start of your next turn, your familiar can't be targeted and your enemies treat all spaces adjacent to you as {@quickref difficult terrain|CRB|3|terrain|0}.

feat.name: Shadows within Shadows
feat.trigger: You would be detected by an enemy {@action Seek||Seeking} you, or an enemy would succeed at a counteract check against a spell making you {@condition hidden}, {@condition concealed}, or {@condition undetected}.
feat.requirements: Your attuned apparition grants {@skill Lore||Hunting Lore} or {@skill Lore||Underworld Lore} as one of its apparition skills.
entries: Your apparition possesses a furtive and elusive nature that can influence and blend with your spiritual energy to form a protective and nearly impenetrable shroud of nondetection around you. The enemy must reroll the triggering check and take the lower result.

feat.name: Whispers of Warning
feat.trigger: You would be hit, but not critically hit, by an attack.
entries: Your protective apparitions alert you to an incoming attack. The attacker must roll its attack roll a second time and take the lower result.

feat.name: Banish Falsehoods of Flesh
entries: Your ability to manipulate supernatural energy allows you to deploy divine magic directly against a disguised enemy to reveal them as they truly are, or to cleanse an ally from an unwilling transformation. Attempt a {@skill Religion} check to counteract a {@trait polymorph} effect currently affecting a creature within 30 feet of you that you are aware of. The target is then temporarily immune to Banish Falsehoods of Flesh for 1 day.

feat.name: Cardinal Guardians
entries: You focus your divine magic to allow your apparitions to work in concert using the magic from one to weaken an enemy against the power of the next. Whenever you succeed at a spell attack with an apparition spell or vessel spell, or when a creature fails its save against such a spell, you gain a +2 status bonus to your spell attack modifier against that creature with spells granted by any of your other apparitions, and it takes a –2 status penalty to its saves against such spells. These benefits last until the end of your next turn.

feat.name: Forest's Heart
feat.requirements: Your attuned apparition grants {@skill Lore||Forest Lore} or {@skill Lore||Herbalism Lore} as one of its apparition skills.
entries: You adopt a stance that allows your apparitions to channel spiritual energy down through you to inhabit roots, control vines, and command plant-life from the ground you stand on to fight on your behalf. You call forth roots, vines, or other plant growth native to the region and can use them to make unarmed attacks. These deal {@damage 4d8} bludgeoning damage, are in the {@group brawling} group, and have the {@trait finesse}, {@trait grapple}, and {@trait reach||reach 30 feet} traits. Attacks made with these unarmed attacks don't gain additional damage from {@item striking} runes, but can benefit from the item bonus to attack rolls and property runes of {@item handwraps of mighty blows (generic)} you wear.

feat.name: Jester's Gambol
feat.requirements: You are attuned to an apparition that grants {@skill Lore||Circus Lore} or {@skill Lore||Fey Lore} as one of its apparition skills.
entries: You adopt a stance that makes your movements carefree and sublimely unpredictable, allowing you to move past impediments with ease and resist the attacks and importunateness of natural threats. You ignore {@quickref difficult terrain|CRB|3|terrain|0}, and you gain resistance equal to half your level against damage dealt to you by animals, beasts, fey, fungi, and plants.

feat.name: Monstrous Inclinations
feat.requirements: Your attuned apparition grants {@skill Lore||Forest Lore} or {@skill Lore||Ocean Lore} as one of its apparition skills.
entries: Your apparitions share with you the monstrous nature of those creatures who dwell in deep seas or ancient woods. You add {@spell monstrosity form} to your apparition spell repertoire, allowing you to cast it with your apparition spellcasting.
special: If you are attuned to a {@optfeature stalker in darkened boughs|WoI} (page 20), add the phoenix form from {@spell monstrosity form} to your available {@spell darkened forest form|WoI} options when you cast the spell heightened to 8th rank.

If you are attuned to a {@optfeature lurker in devouring dark|WoI} (page 19), add the cave worm and sea serpent forms to your {@spell devouring dark form|WoI} options as a {@trait polymorph} effect when you cast the spell heightened to 8th rank.

feat.name: Spiritual Spellshape Stance
entries: You feed excess magical power into your apparition, allowing it to grow ethereal limbs it can use to help shape and focus your spells. Once per turn while in this stance, you can use a {@filter spellshape feat that normally requires one action|feats||general=spellshape|activity=action} as a free action instead, but only to affect spells that deal spirit, vitality, or void damage. This doesn't allow you to avoid or bypass any other restrictions or limitations normally associated with the spellshape feat.

feat.name: Cycle of Souls
feat.prerequisites: liturgist practice, at least one {@filter animist stance|feats||class=animist|combat=stance}
entries: Your spiritual allies guide your movements, allowing you to prepare for the trials before you at a speed faster than thought.
You {@action Step}, then enter an animist stance you know.

feat.name: Echoing Channel
entries: When you channel the powers of life and death, your apparition absorbs and enhances the spiritual energy, carrying it to a nearby ally. If the next action you use is to cast a 2-action {@spell harm} or {@spell heal} to heal or damage a single creature, choose yourself or one other additional creature adjacent to either you or the target. Target that creature with a 1-action version of the same spell, even if they would otherwise be out the spell's range. This spell is the same rank as the 2-action {@spell harm} or {@spell heal} you cast and doesn't cost another spell slot.

feat.name: Spirit's Sacrifice
entries: Your attuned apparition gathers all of the energy it can through your shared bond and uses that power to disperse itself while channeling the energy back into you, saving your life. You can use Spirit's Sacrifice even while {@condition unconscious} or otherwise unable to act. Choose one apparition you have attuned; you do not die, your {@condition wounded} condition is reduced to 1 if it would be higher, and you regain a number of Hit Points equal to twice your level. The chosen apparition is dispersed until you can re-attune to it at your next daily preparations.

feat.name: Eternal Guide
entries: Your attuned apparitions recognize that you still have essential work to do and refuse to allow you to pass on, gathering up your essence to carry your soul back to the community you call home. Choose a single settlement with a population of at least 100 people. Whenever you die and are not returned to life within 24 hours by other means, as long as the settlement still exists and there are no other claims on your soul (such as a contract with a devil) and nothing trapping your soul (such as being slain by a critical hit from a vilderavn), your attuned apparition magically transports your soul, remains, and all of the items you had worn or carried at the time of your death (so long as they have not been otherwise recovered) back to the chosen settlement, where you are reborn. The nature of this rebirth varies between animists; some magically reconstitute and reinvigorate their physical forms to return to life in their original bodies, while others pass their knowledge and power on to a new inheritor who effectively takes their place in the grand story of existence. When returned to your original physical form in this manner, you are brought back in your physical prime, restored to youthful health and vigor. This effectively makes you immune to {@condition dying} of old age so long as you are not killed by violence less than a week before you would have died of old age.

Regardless of the exact nature of your rebirth, you or your inheritor are fully restored with your level, experience, and equipment intact one week after your death. If you choose an inheritor and their ancestry is different than yours, your attribute scores do not change but you can freely retrain your ancestry feats and any other feats that relied on them as prerequisites as part of your rebirth.

There is no limit to the number of times you can be reborn, but if you die before a week has passed since your last rebirth, neither you nor your attuned apparitions have recovered enough energy to complete the process again, and your soul passes to whatever final reward it has earned.

feat.name: True Channel Spell
entries: You are a true conduit for spiritual power, able to unleash the greatest spells. You gain a single 10th-rank spell slot and can prepare a spell in that slot using animist spellcasting. You can't use 10th-rank slots with abilities that give you more spell slots or that let you cast spells without expending spell slots.
